question: Due to which of the following reasons the Superconductors are so called?
option1: Efficiently conduct heat from one hot body to another
option2: Offer no resistance to conduction of heat at high temperatures
option3: Offer no resistance to conduction of electricity at low temperatures
option4: Produce high temperatures while conducting electricity
answer: Offer no resistance to conduction of electricity at low temperatures
explanation: It takes a significant amount of energy to scatter an electron from the condensate – more than the thermal energy available to an electron below the critical temperature – so the superconducting electrons can flow without being scattered, that is, without any resistance.
